citation.abstract: Small bowel bacterial overgrowth secondary to drug-induced hypochlorhydria may be of particular importance in the elderly, in whom anti-ulcer drugs are commonly prescribed and the consequences of malabsorption may be severe.
citation.title: Drug-induced hypochlorhydria causes high duodenal bacterial counts in the elderly.
